cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest, cross the northern Yucatan late Monday, then accelerate north-north-eastward across the central Gulf toward the north-central Gulf Coast (LA/MS/AL) by Wednesday night/early Thursday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch/Warning confined to the northern Yucatan Peninsula; Tropical-Storm Warning for Pinar del Rio, Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Tulum to Rio Lagartos, including Cozumel (Yucatan Peninsula); Tropical-Storm Warning Pinar del Rio, Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula Monday, then north-central Gulf Coast (southeast LA to coastal MS/AL) mid-week
weather_observation.first_hazard: Arrival of tropical storm-force winds (low confidence)
weather_observation.wind: Only a slight (â‰¤4%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds mid-week; prevailing winds likely below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Upper Texas coast from Zeta.
weather_observation.rainfall: No significant rainfall anticipated at Texas City from Zeta; heaviest rains forecast well east of Texas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor swell and rip-current risk in the Gulf; otherwise no major hazards expected for port operations.
